sentence: Drawing water can be quite difficult.
ending: Her degree in aquatic illustration would be helpful, though.

explanation:
• "Drawing water" is a common and plausible activity in the countryside setting, especially given the mention of the well and Emma’s daily tasks.  
• The precontext mentions Emma being at the well and doing household tasks, which strongly supports "drawing water" as a literal, physical action.  
• The ending references "aquatic illustration," which suggests a connection to drawing as art, but this does not support "drawing" as in making marks; instead, it reinforces the idea of artistic drawing, making the literal "drawing water" interpretation even more distinct and contextually grounded.
